intro: Andinia composita, commonly known as the composite bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem, while its flowers are clustered in loose racemes. Andinia composita is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
